title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Home-price growth in the U.S. held at a record high in August, as demand from home buyers remained robust.

The S&P 500 and Dow rose 0.2% and 0.04%, respectively, to records, while the Nasdaq added 0.1%.

GE posted stronger profit, with cost cuts offsetting lower-than-expected sales of its industrial equipment in the September quarter.

Robinhood's revenue fell in the third quarter from the previous one, weighed down by a decline in customers' cryptocurrency trading.

Twitter largely dodged turmoil in the digital ad market from new Apple app privacy policies, reporting a 37% jump in third-quarter revenue.

DraftKings is dropping its roughly $22 billion bid to acquire Entain, a major international player in the gambling industry.

Evercore is naming John Weinberg as its sole chief executive. Co-CEO Ralph Schlosstein will step down in February.

What's News: Business & Finance
